titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Diamond Family Bookplates)
Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Diamond Family Bookplates)
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Sonja Foard

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 23:01

did.unittitle: Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Diamond Family Bookplates)
did.abstract: This collection contains numerous bookplates commissioned by various members of the Diamond Family. J. Edouard "Jack" Diamond and Elizabeth Watson Diamond were avid bookplate collectors and the proprietors of Hyacinth Press, a small private press which they operated from their home in Cleveland, OH.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Irene D. Andrews Pace, 1963, in memory of Dr. Edmund Andrews (Yale 1913) and his father, Dr. E. Wyllys Andrews.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Andrews Memorial Bookplate Collection of Irene D. Andrews Pace (Diamond Family Bookplates), Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born Irene Greene Dwen, Mrs. Pace (1892-1962) was an avid bookplate collector from the early 1920s until 1962. In addition to over 150,000 plates in her collection, she also maintained a reference library related to bookplates, as well as heraldry and biographical research. Pace commissioned several hundred bookplates for herself. In 1936, she published Owners of Books: The Dissipations of a Collector .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains numerous bookplates commissioned by various members of the Diamond Family. J. Edouard "Jack" Diamond and Elizabeth Watson Diamond were avid bookplate collectors and the proprietors of Hyacinth Press, a small private press which they operated from their home in Cleveland, OH. Two works published by Hyacinth Press are also part of the Yale Bookplate Collection: Bookplates by Sara Eugenia Blake, Call # Z996.B635 B535 1940 (LC); and Bookplates of Hettie Gray Baker , Call # Z996 B25 B66 1947 (LC).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by the artist's last name, according to the original order and an accompanying checklist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains 2 bookplate restrikes from a Thomas Bewick woodblock, plus 9 additional unidentified prints, which were all housed together.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder includes a bookplate that is a restrike from a copperplate by Franz von Bayros. The name was changed by Will Simmons, and the bookplate was used by Diamond in her books on music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains a bookplate that is based on an illustration by Sir John Tenniel of the tea party from Alice's Adventures in Wonderland .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains two different bookplate designs for Elizabeth Watson Diamond (signed TM, undated) and Elisabeth Watson Diamond (signed gd, dated XMAS '46).
